content.description: Cylindrical resistors <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are made from the same material. Resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math> has length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, diameter <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>, and resistance <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has length <math alttext="2 L" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></math>, diameter <math alttext="4 D" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>D</mi></math>, and resistance <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
content.question: What is the ratio <math alttext="R sub 2 to R sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>R</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <msub> <mi>R</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
